name: Osium AI
headline: Speed up materials innovation with Artificial Intelligence
description:
Our AI-powered software enables materials R&D engineers to design new materials much faster. 

To date, manufacturing companies rely on trial-and-error and manual approaches to develop new materials. This is a tedious and time-consuming process. Yet, carbon neutrality requirements urge manufacturers to adopt greener and lighter materials to decarbonize the industry.

founders.name: Sarah Najmark, Founder
founders.description:
Sarah is the co-founder and CEO of Osium AI, which she started with Luisa Bouneder, her close friend since College.

She studied Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry at Ecole Centrale Paris. She holds a Master in Science from Stanford University where she conducted and led AI research. 

Sarah has deep expertise in AI technologies applied to complex systems as she spent 3 years as a Tech Lead and Product Manager at Google X, the moonshot division of Google. She authored 2 AI patents.

founders.name: Luisa Bouneder, Founder
founders.description:
Luisa is the co-founder and CTO of Osium AI, which she started with Sarah Najmark, her close friend since College.
She studied Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry at Ecole Polytechnique, France. She holds a Master in Science from Stanford University where she conducted and led AI research. She has hands-on experience in building AI tools for industry leaders thanks to her years of experience in Data Science services in the Materials and Life Science industries.

generated_description:
**Osium AI: Accelerating Materials Innovation with AI**

Founded in 2023 and based in Paris, Osium AI is on a mission to speed up materials innovation through the power of artificial intelligence. Part of the Y Combinator Batch S23, this startup is tackling a significant challenge in the manufacturing industry: the outdated trial-and-error methods that currently dominate materials R&D. 

Manufacturers are increasingly pressured to develop greener and lighter materials to meet carbon neutrality goals, and Osium AI's technology is designed to help them do just that. Their AI-powered software enables materials R&D engineers to design new materials ten times faster than traditional methods, eliminating much of the tedious manual work involved in material development. 

**Key Features of Osium AI's Solutions:**
- **Speed:** The software accelerates the development process significantly, allowing rapid iterations and quicker results.
- **Modeling:** Users can predict the properties of materials and chemicals in seconds, greatly enhancing decision-making.
- **Comprehensive Support:** Osium AI covers all stages of material and chemical development—from formulation to manufacturing—providing an all-in-one solution.
- **Flexibility:** The software adapts to evolving R&D needs, making it a valuable asset for companies as their projects grow and change.

In its short existence, Osium AI has gained the trust of over 50 innovators in the materials and chemicals sectors and claims to provide significant competitive advantages through its intelligent solutions. The team, currently just two people strong, is led by experts who have a decade of AI experience and multiple patents to their names.

The gravity of their work is reflected in its numerous applications across various industries, including energy (for better battery materials), packaging (for greener materials), aerospace (for lighter composites), and many more.

If you're keen to see how this technology can transform your R&D process, you can [request a demo](https://osium.ai/<./request-a-demo>).

Visit their [website](https://osium.ai/) for more insights and details. Osium AI is not just a company; it’s a forward-thinking solution in the quest for sustainable materials innovation.
